AWB/FWB does not show any DG material and/or special codes as DGD, RFL. HAWB/FHL has been provided as CIVIL AIRCRAFT PARTS DGD attached with the documents and with the freight.

item.title: Report E-2024010395
item.description:
Report E-2024010395

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As a result of a forklift puncture, a 5-gallon jerrican containing Kiwo Stencil Remover was punctured and released 1-gallon of product onto the concrete dock floor impacting a 5'x5' area. A Contractor clean-up the release with oil dry. The damaged product, spill debris, and PPE were containerized for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by the incident.

item.title: Report E-2024010385
item.description:
Report E-2024010385

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported 14 oz. release of (UN1950) NON-CHLORINATED BRAKE CLEANER from an aerosol can inside of a carton on their trailer. The release was contained inside of the carton. The spill was due to improper loading from terminal LFW. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt confident cleaning the release and containerizing waste into a 8-gallon DM, which was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010398
item.description:
Report E-2024010398

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 19, 2024, at 2053 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LEP. It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of El Pinol 85 (Pine Oil 60%) UN1272 was released from 55-gallon metal drum due to pinhole puncture. The release impacted the dock and trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable that terminal personnel was capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on-site. The terminal did not have a drum large enough to overpack the damaged drum that was leaking. ERTS dispatched contractors to drop off an 85-gallon metal drum for terminal personnel. Once arrived, terminal personnel placed the damaged drum and all impacted absorbents into the drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010687
item.description:
Report X-2024010687

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-29T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-27
  • City: SPRING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was unloaded from trailer, after handling the package was found releasing internally. package was removed from the sortation, spill contained in packaging. DescribePack: packaging didn't fail, the body of the plastic pail in the overpack failed. the base of the pail suffered an impact causing the integrity of the base to give. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package placed on its side in hazmat containment tote. plastic pail kept inside box housing for containment.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: On 12/15/2023 The WFRX 155967 was found to be leaking from the Manway. Hazmat responders inspected the manway and found the gasket to be leaking. Responders replaced the gasket tighten all bolts and secondary closures and the car was released for movement.
